adjective.description: Of a prince or state: reduced in power or position. Compare mediatize. Now historical.
Mediated; reduced in power or effect by the interposition of a mediating agent. By extension: rendered subject to the controlling influence of the mass media.

origin: Early 19th century. From mediate + -ized, probably after German mediatisieren mediatize. Compare mediatization, and slightly later mediatize.
